result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward Burton

records.addlTxt:
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. 
Defendant Edward Burton not in court, in custody.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii appeared by video for Edward Burton.  Attorney James Griffin in court on behalf of Attorney Amanda Korin Kirklewski for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense informs the court of new charges and requests another status conference.  No objection from the State.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Edward Burton not in court, in custody.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Edward Burton.  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Korin Kirklewski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's appearance is waived, defendant is being held under the name Tony Smith. Defense is requesting a status conference. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Edward Burton in court, appear by video with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw, appear by video.  Defendant Edward Burton in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer M. Zanlewski.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Edward Burton in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  Defendant Edward Burton in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Edward Burton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
